snippet: The recall covers 10 countries and represents a blow to the South Korean company’s effort to catch up with the Apple iPhone.
abstract: Samsung announces it is recalling Galaxy Note 7 smartphone because flaw in lithium-ion batteries may cause device to burst into flames; recall damages company's reputation and will probably decrease third quarter profits.

headline.main: Samsung to Recall 2.5 Million Galaxy Note 7s Over Battery Fires
headline.print_headline: Samsung Recalls Phone  Over Risk of Battery Fire

byline.original: By PAUL MOZUR and SU-HYUN LEE

snippet: The company’s chief executive said in an interview with an Irish broadcaster that the European Union’s tax decision was “maddening” and politically motivated.
abstract: Apple chief exec Timothy Cook defends firm's tax practices in interview with Irish broadcaster RTE; Margrethe Vestager, competition commissioner for European Union, says recent decision ordering Ireland to collect $14.5 billion from Apple for unpaid taxes was based on laws preventing members from favorably treating certain companies; American officials are against ruling because it hampers their efforts to collect taxes on tech giant's $215 billion stockpile of overseas cash.

headline.main: Tim Cook, Apple Chief, Defends Tax Practices and Says Cash Will Return to U.S.
headline.print_headline: Apple Chief Angrily Defends Tax Practices Against a ‘Wrongheaded’ Ruling

snippet: The European Commission rejected criticism from one of its own former antitrust chiefs on Friday of its massive tax demand on Apple and pointedly noted that she now works for another U.S. tech company, Uber.

headline.main: EU Rebuffs Vestager Predecessor's Criticism of Apple Move
headline.print_headline: EU Rebuffs Vestager Predecessor's Criticism of Apple Move

snippet: Apple CEO Tim Cook has said he will appeal the European Commission's ruling that his company received an unlawful 13 billion euro ($14.5 billion) subsidy when Ireland gave it preferential tax deals and that he was confident the decision would be r...

headline.main: Apple Appeal Against EU Tax Demand Would Break New Ground
headline.print_headline: Apple Appeal Against EU Tax Demand Would Break New Ground

snippet: Ireland's cabinet agreed on Friday to join Apple in appealing against a multi-billion-euro back tax demand that the European Commission has imposed on the iPhone maker, despite misgivings among independents who back the fragile coalition.

headline.main: Ireland to Join Apple in Fight Against EU Tax Ruling
headline.print_headline: Ireland to Join Apple in Fight Against EU Tax Ruling

snippet: Ireland's government stands fully behind its corporate tax regime, Public Expenditure Minister Paschal Donohoe said on Friday, ahead of an independent review it commissioned into how multinationals pay their tax.

headline.main: Ireland Fully Behind Corporate Tax Regime Ahead of Review: Minister
headline.print_headline: Ireland Fully Behind Corporate Tax Regime Ahead of Review: Minister

snippet: Ireland's coalition government has committed to holding an independent review of the country's corporate tax system after it agreed on Friday to join Apple in appealing against a multi-billion-euro back tax demand from the European Commission.

headline.main: Ireland to Hold Independent Review of Corporate Tax System
headline.print_headline: Ireland to Hold Independent Review of Corporate Tax System

snippet: Multinationals like coffee chain Starbucks and online retailer Amazon pay less tax in Austria than one of the country's tiny sausage stands, the republic's center-left chancellor lamented in an interview published on Friday.

headline.main: Starbucks, Amazon Pay Less Tax Than a Sausage Stand, Austria Says
headline.print_headline: Starbucks, Amazon Pay Less Tax Than a Sausage Stand, Austria Says

snippet: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd recalled all Galaxy Note 7 smartphones equipped with batteries it has found to be fire-prone and halted their sales in 10 markets, denting a revival of the firm's mobile business.

headline.main: Samsung Recalls Galaxy Note 7 Phones After Battery Fires
headline.print_headline: Samsung Recalls Galaxy Note 7 Phones After Battery Fires

snippet: Tech giant Samsung Electronics Co Ltd is considering a recall of its new flagship Galaxy Note 7 devices amid reports that some of the premium phones are catching fire due to battery problems, a person familiar with the matter said on Friday.

headline.main: Samsung Electronics Considers Galaxy Note 7 Recall-Source
headline.print_headline: Samsung Electronics Considers Galaxy Note 7 Recall-Source
